--- title: Pronator Quadratus --- ![Muscles that move the Forearm @OpenStaxAnatomyPhysiology2022](/The Archive/Images/OpenStax Anatomy and Physiology 2e/fig11.25 Muscles That Move the Forearm.jpeg){#fig-openstax-fig11.25} ::: {.callout title="Reading list"} - Wrist and finger flexor Muscles @donnellyTravellSimonsSimons2019 - @neumannKinesiologyMusculoskeletalSystem2017 ::: ::: {#tbl-pronator-quadratus-oian .cell message='false' execution_count=1} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ```{=html}
Muscle Origin Insertion Innervation Action
Pronator quadratus Distal 1/4 of anterior Ulna Distal 1/4 of anterior Radius Median n.
C8 - T1		 Elbow/Forearm: Pronation
Distal RUJ: Stabilization
``` ::: ::: # Origin {#origin} The PQ's proximal origin is at the anterior surface of the distal 1/4 of ulna [@gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020; @jonesProjectFoundations2025] and on an aponeurosis that partially covers the muscle [@jonesProjectFoundations2025]. # Insertion {#insertion} The PQ courses from its [common origin](#origin) and separates into superficial and deep fibers @jonesProjectFoundations2025. The **superficial fibers** project laterally and insert onto the distal 1/4th of radius (anterior surface) [@gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020; @jonesProjectFoundations2025]. The **deeper fibers** project laterally from the [common origin](#origin) and insert superior to the *radius' ulnar notch* @jonesProjectFoundations2025. # Innervation {#innervation} [Anterior Interosseous N.]({{< var ref-anterior-interosseous-nerve.path >}}) ([C8]({{< var ref-nerve-root.c8 >}}), [T1]({{< var ref-nerve-root.t1 >}})) @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 # Action {#action} - **Forearm**: Pronation @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020, specifically at the proximal radioulnar joint @jonesProjectFoundations2025. - During this action, the radial head pivots around the ulna @jonesProjectFoundations2025. - **Distal RUJ**: Stabilization @gilroyAtlasAnatomy2020 by holding the distal radius and ulna together @jonesProjectFoundations2025. - This stabilization and protective function also protects the interosseous membrane @jonesProjectFoundations2025. The PQ "unwinds" ulna around the radius @jonesProjectFoundations2025. # Notes
